intro: Pagiantha sessilifolia, commonly known as the sessile-leaf pagiantha, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its small, sessile leaves that are often clustered at the base of the stem. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, and they are arranged in clusters. Pagiantha sessilifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
